title: Opera singer Mario Lanza's childhood home demolished in South Philly
title_page: Opera singer Mario Lanza's childhood home demolished in South Philly
maintext:
By Staff
Philadelphia opera singer Mario Lanza’s childhood Philly home is being demolished to make way for a new residential development project.
Lanza, a famed opera singer who died at age 38 in 1959, was born and spent the first part of his life at 636 Christian Street in South Philadelphia. The two-floor rowhome, along with several other adjacent properties, will be replaced with two 43-foot-tall buildings that will share a gated driveway, according to proposed construction plans.
